elements.title: New Time Units for Higher Productivity (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Productivity

New Time Units for Higher Productivity

Our common measures of time never worked for me for time management. So I invented my own.

elements.title: The Input Channel Audit (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Atomic Essay: Attention Design

The Input Channel Audit

A quick How To guide for shaping your information diet

elements.title: Develop Strong Criteria for Input Triage (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Atomic Essay: Attention Design

Develop Strong Criteria for Input Triage

'How in the world. You need less Twitter in your life.' I had, again, discarded my guard rails of attention design and failed at input triage.

elements.title: The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops

Personal Knowledge Management is too restrictive – you want to think about all seven of these questions instead.

elements.title: The Grazing – Feeding Model of Information Gathering (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Grazing – Feeding Model of Information Gathering

On the Internet, information is limitless. The Grazing-Feeding Model of Information Gathering helps you know how you're engaging with that information.

elements.title: Sadly, Constraints Are Real (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Atomic Essay: Constraints

Sadly, Constraints Are Real

For the last 15 years I've ignored one fundamental truth: real constraints exist. Here's what I'm trying now.

elements.title: Adversarial Reading (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

Adversarial Reading

Bullshit is everywhere, and these algorithms of thought help you do more adversarial reading.

elements.title: How to improve a process (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

How to improve a process

With taking notes as an example, let's talk about how to improve any process.

elements.title: Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Atomic Essay: Note-taking

Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System

You should stick to one note-taking system and fiddle with it as little as possible. That's a myth.

elements.title: Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Peer Review

Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals

Why to get rid of peer review and academic journals as we know them – and possibly what to do instead.

elements.title: You Actually Need to Context Switch (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

You Actually Need to Context Switch

Common wisdom says that you need to avoid context switching. That's only half true – sometimes you need to context switch.

elements.title: How to Context Switch Like a Pro (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Productivity

How to Context Switch Like a Pro

Context switching is unavoidable – but you can make it less costly by combining a couple of simple strategies.

elements.title: A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Reading

A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News

Counter two frequent biases while reading the news: Selection Bias and Description Bias.

elements.title: How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Interstitial Journaling

How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling

Interstitial Journaling is a great technique for minimizing context switching costs and staying productive. Here's how I use it in Roam Reserch.

elements.title: Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Academic Workflow

Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager

A guide to reference managers, what you should expect from them and why Zotero is the reference manager you should use - whether you're in academia or not.

elements.title: Behavior First, Theory Second (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Learning

Behavior First, Theory Second

Behavior and Theory are two heuristics that can help you in deciding between courses and teachers.

elements.title: True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived

Can you imagine being able to transfer 'mental software' between people? It's now possible, by using Algorithms of Thought in Roam Research.

elements.title: The Power of Keystone Habits with Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Programming Attention

The Power of Keystone Habits with Roam Research

How to use Roam Research as your keystone habit to regularly revisit writing that is important to you, using the ∆ feature in Roam.

elements.title: Zotero and Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Academic Workflow

Zotero and Roam Research

A guide for using Roam Research together with Zotero to get the most out of your citation metadata.

elements.title: A short (preliminary) guide to Spaced Repetition in Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Spaced Repetition

A short (preliminary) guide to Spaced Repetition in Roam Research

How to use Roam Research's new Delta feature to do Spaced Repetition and never forget anything again.

elements.title: My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Zettelkasten

My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper

My grandfather's way of doing history research before the computer age. Using paper and a meticulous process, he built something close to a Zettelkasten.

elements.title: How to cure Highlight Dementia (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Reading

How to cure Highlight Dementia

How to make sure that you never lose insights when reading and highlighting. Because Highlight Dementia is completely preventable.

elements.title: Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Reading

Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery

How discovery became an actor's concept - and what you can use that for. Can you play chess without knowing that you are doing so?

elements.title: Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Reading

Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought

An introduction to Algorithms of Thought - how they differ from Mental Models and how to use them in Roam Research.

elements.title: Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Polymathy

Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures

There are words you can't use to describe yourself without sounding like an utter ass. Imagine asking someone at a party who they are and they respond with 'Nice to meet you, I'm a brilliant photographer/physicist/writer' - instant, life-long friends you'll be, no?

elements.title: The Right to Disagree (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

The Right to Disagree

Contrary to popular belief, you can't just disagree with someone because you feel like it. You have to __earn__ the right to disagree with someone's position.

elements.title: A Gruvbox Theme for Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Roam Research

A Gruvbox Theme for Roam Research

How to create a Gruvbox-style color theme for Roam Research using Roam's built-in CSS capabilities.

elements.title: Rapid quasi-periodic oscillations in the relativistic jet of BL Lacertae (Nature - table of contents)
elements.contents:
Rapid quasi-periodic oscillations in the relativistic jet of BL Lacertae

Analysis of the optical and γ-ray flux monitoring of the blazar BL Lacertae during its outburst in 2020 shows the existence of quasi-periodic oscillations in the relativistic jet with cycles as short as 13 h.

  • S. G. Jorstad
  • A. P. Marscher
  • R. Chatterjee
Article 07 Sept 2022

elements.title: A sustained high-temperature fusion plasma regime facilitated by fast ions (Nature - table of contents)
elements.contents:
A sustained high-temperature fusion plasma regime facilitated by fast ions

A magnetic confinement regime established at the Korea Superconducting Tokamak Advanced Research device enables the generation of plasmas over 108 kelvin for 20 seconds with the aid of fast ions without plasma edge instabilities or impurity accumulation.

  • H. Han
  • S. J. Park
  • Y.-S. Na
Article 07 Sept 2022

elements.title: Imaging hydrodynamic electrons flowing without Landauer–Sharvin resistance (Nature - table of contents)
elements.contents:
Imaging hydrodynamic electrons flowing without Landauer–Sharvin resistance

At elevated temperatures, electron hydrodynamics efficiently eliminate the ‘bulk Landauer–Sharvin’ resistance, demonstrating that hydrodynamics can dramatically modify the well-established rules obeyed by ballistic electrons.

  • C. Kumar
  • J. Birkbeck
  • S. Ilani
Article 07 Sept 2022

elements.title: Exciton-coupled coherent magnons in a 2D semiconductor (Nature - table of contents)
elements.contents:
Exciton-coupled coherent magnons in a 2D semiconductor

Excitons in the electronvolts range are found to couple strongly to coherent magnons in hundreds of microelectronvolts in an atomically thin two-dimensional antiferromagnetic semiconductor.

  • Youn Jue Bae
  • Jue Wang
  • Xiaoyang Zhu
Article 07 Sept 2022

elements.title: Bifunctional hydroformylation on heterogeneous Rh-WOx pair site catalysts (Nature - table of contents)
elements.contents:
Bifunctional hydroformylation on heterogeneous Rh-WOx pair site catalysts

Catalysts consisting of oxide-supported pair sites can enable bifunctional reaction mechanisms with high activity and selectivity for reactions and so overcome the limitations in industry imposed by the use of homogeneous catalysts.

  • Insoo Ro
  • Ji Qi
  • Phillip Christopher
Article 07 Sept 2022

elements.title: Intrinsically unidirectional chemically fuelled rotary molecular motors (Nature - table of contents)
elements.contents:
Intrinsically unidirectional chemically fuelled rotary molecular motors

A homochiral rotary molecular motor shows autonomous unidirectional rotation around a single bond driven by a chemical fuel.

  • Ke Mo
  • Yu Zhang
  • Depeng Zhao
Article 06 Jul 2022

elements.title: Delayed use of bioenergy crops might threaten climate and food security (Nature - table of contents)
elements.contents:
Delayed use of bioenergy crops might threaten climate and food security

Simulations of historical and future periods of climate change showed that delayed mitigation to limit global warming might reduce the capacity of bioenergy with carbon capture and storage and threaten climate stability and food security.

  • Siqing Xu
  • Rong Wang
  • Renhe Zhang
Article 07 Sept 2022

elements.title: Chiral monoterpenes reveal forest emission mechanisms and drought responses (Nature - table of contents)
elements.contents:
Chiral monoterpenes reveal forest emission mechanisms and drought responses

Analysis of atmospheric data on two enantiomerically separated forms of monoterpene from a controlled drought and rewetting experiment in an enclosed tropical rainforest ecosystem showed distinct diel emission peaks, regulated by different production pathways.

  • Joseph Byron
  • Juergen Kreuzwieser
  • Jonathan Williams
Article Open Access 07 Sept 2022

elements.title: Africa’s oldest dinosaurs reveal early suppression of dinosaur distribution (Nature - table of contents)
elements.contents:
Africa’s oldest dinosaurs reveal early suppression of dinosaur distribution

A new Triassic dinosaur assemblage from Zimbabwe reveals that the earliest dinosaurs were confined to a temperate region in the far south of Pangaea.

  • Christopher T. Griffin
  • Brenen M. Wynd
  • Hazel R. Taruvinga
Article 31 Aug 2022

elements.title: A brainstem map for visceral sensations (Nature - table of contents)
elements.contents:
A brainstem map for visceral sensations

In vivo two-photon calcium imaging analyses of sensory inputs from the gastrointestinal tract and upper airways in mice reveal spatial organization and coding principles of the interoceptive nervous system.

  • Chen Ran
  • Jack C. Boettcher
  • Stephen D. Liberles
Article Open Access 31 Aug 2022

elements.title: Fos ensembles encode and shape stable spatial maps in the hippocampus (Nature - table of contents)
elements.contents:
Fos ensembles encode and shape stable spatial maps in the hippocampus

Fos-expressing hippocampal neurons form highly correlated ensembles that contribute to spatial coding by forming reliable, long-lasting and spatially unbiased maps of an environment.

  • Noah L. Pettit
  • Ee-Lynn Yap
  • Christopher D. Harvey
Article Open Access 24 Aug 2022

elements.title: Archaic chaperone–usher pili self-secrete into superelastic zigzag springs (Nature - table of contents)
elements.contents:
Archaic chaperone–usher pili self-secrete into superelastic zigzag springs

The Csu pili of the multidrug-resistant nosocomial pathogen Acinetobacter baumannii assemble into an ultrathin zigzag architecture secured by a clinch mechanism that provides the pilus with high mechanical stability and superelasticity.

  • Natalia Pakharukova
  • Henri Malmi
  • Anton V. Zavialov
Article Open Access 19 Jul 2022

elements.title: A microbial supply chain for production of the anti-cancer drug vinblastine (Nature - table of contents)
elements.contents:
A microbial supply chain for production of the anti-cancer drug vinblastine

De novo microbial biosynthesis of vindoline and catharanthine using a highly engineered yeast and in vitro chemical coupling to vinblastine is carried out, positioning yeast as a scalable platform to produce many monoterpene indole alkaloids.

  • Jie Zhang
  • Lea G. Hansen
  • Jay D. Keasling
Article Open Access 31 Aug 2022

elements.title: LACC1 bridges NOS2 and polyamine metabolism in inflammatory macrophages (Nature - table of contents)
elements.contents:
LACC1 bridges NOS2 and polyamine metabolism in inflammatory macrophages

Findings suggest that l-ornithine could serve as a novel nutraceutical to ameliorate LACC1-associated immunological dysfunctions.

  • Zheng Wei
  • Joonseok Oh
  • Jason M. Crawford
Article 17 Aug 2022

elements.title: MYB orchestrates T cell exhaustion and response to checkpoint inhibition (Nature - table of contents)
elements.contents:
MYB orchestrates T cell exhaustion and response to checkpoint inhibition

CD62L+ precursors of exhausted T cells retain long-term proliferative potential, multipotency and repopulation capacity, and the transcription factor MYB is essential for the development and function of this population of cells.

  • Carlson Tsui
  • Lorenz Kretschmer
  • Axel Kallies
Article Open Access 17 Aug 2022

elements.title: Apoptotic brown adipocytes enhance energy expenditure via extracellular inosine (Nature - table of contents)
elements.contents:
Apoptotic brown adipocytes enhance energy expenditure via extracellular inosine

Untargeted metabolomics demonstrate that apoptotic brown adipocytes release a specific pattern of metabolites with purine metabolites being highly enriched, and inosine is identified as a metabolite released during apoptosis regulating thermogenic fat and counteracting obesity.

  • Birte Niemann
  • Saskia Haufs-Brusberg
  • Alexander Pfeifer
Article Open Access 05 Jul 2022

elements.title: Non-viral, specifically targeted CAR-T cells achieve high safety and efficacy in B-NHL (Nature - table of contents)
elements.contents:
Non-viral, specifically targeted CAR-T cells achieve high safety and efficacy in B-NHL

Non-viral CAR-T cells with gene-specific targeted integration are safe and effective in patients with lymphoma.

  • Jiqin Zhang
  • Yongxian Hu
  • He Huang

Collection:

  • Cancer at Nature Portfolio
Article Open Access 31 Aug 2022

elements.title: Spatial profiling of chromatin accessibility in mouse and human tissues (Nature - table of contents)
elements.contents:
Spatial profiling of chromatin accessibility in mouse and human tissues

Spatial-ATAC-seq—spatially resolved chromatin accessibility profiling of tissue sections using next-generation sequencing—delineated tissue-region-specific epigenetic landscapes in mouse embryos and identified gene regulators involved in the development of the central nervous system and the lymphoid tissue.

  • Yanxiang Deng
  • Marek Bartosovic
  • Rong Fan
Article Open Access 17 Aug 2022

elements.title: Selective TnsC recruitment enhances the fidelity of RNA-guided transposition (Nature - table of contents)
elements.contents:
Selective TnsC recruitment enhances the fidelity of RNA-guided transposition

CRISPR-associated transposons exploit a proofreading checkpoint to ensure high-fidelity selection of genomic sites for DNA insertion through specific recruitment of TnsC oligomers by the Cascade complex.

  • Florian T. Hoffmann
  • Minjoo Kim
  • Samuel H. Sternberg
Article 24 Aug 2022

elements.title: In vivo single-molecule analysis reveals COOLAIR RNA structural diversity (Nature - table of contents)
elements.contents:
In vivo single-molecule analysis reveals COOLAIR RNA structural diversity

The structures of single COOLAIR RNA isoforms change in abundance and shape in response to external conditions; structural mutation of these isoforms altered FLC expression and flowering time, consistent with a regulatory role of the COOLAIR structure in FLC transcription.

  • Minglei Yang
  • Pan Zhu
  • Yiliang Ding
Article Open Access 17 Aug 2022

elements.title: Structural basis for SHOC2 modulation of RAS signalling (Nature - table of contents)
elements.contents:
Structural basis for SHOC2 modulation of RAS signalling

Cryo-electron microscopy structure, molecular dynamics and biochemical analyses of the SHOC2–PP1C–MRAS complex demonstrate the dependence of the complex formation on RAS–GTP and identify the determinants of RAS isoform preference for SHOC2–PP1C and specificity of the complex for RAF dephosphorylation.

  • Nicholas P. D. Liau
  • Matthew C. Johnson
  • Jawahar Sudhamsu
Article Open Access 29 Jun 2022

elements.title: Structure–function analysis of the SHOC2–MRAS–PP1C holophosphatase complex (Nature - table of contents)
elements.contents:
Structure–function analysis of the SHOC2–MRAS–PP1C holophosphatase complex

  • Jason J. Kwon
  • Behnoush Hajian
  • Andrew J. Aguirre
Article 13 Jul 2022

elements.title: Structure of the MRAS–SHOC2–PP1C phosphatase complex (Nature - table of contents)
elements.contents:
Structure of the MRAS–SHOC2–PP1C phosphatase complex

A structure of the MRAS–SHOC2–PP1C complex supports a RAS-driven and multi-molecular model for RAF activation in which individual RAS–GTP molecules recruit RAF–14-3-3 and SHOC2–PP1C to activate the downstream pathway.

  • Zachary J. Hauseman
  • Michelle Fodor
  • Daniel A. King
Article Open Access 13 Jul 2022
